comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Possibly Flemming Duncan Cheshire (1849 - 1922), American consul general at Canton, China from 1912 to 1915. In 1915, he was stricken with paralysis, see El Paso herald., December 08, 1915, HOME EDITION, Page 5, column 3. See also Honolulu star-bulletin., March 11, 1914, 2:30 Edition, Image 1, "CONSUL-GENERAL AT CANTON IS A LOCAL VISITOR". A short biography of Flemming Duncan Cheshire in The United States in Asia: A Historical Dictionary, by David Shavit, Page 92. If so, he was 66 years old in 1915. He looks younger though.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Sometimes portraits  in the Bain collection are from much earlier than the time they appear in the news stream.  This is probably one of those.

comment.author: 34911459@N08
comment._content: B-59 thanks for the additional information.  We will look further into this before making any changes to the source data.
